isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - ASSEMBLY - SPINDLE AND BRAKE TO STEERING KNUCKLE

svcproc.title: SPINDLE AND BRAKE TO STEERING KNUCKLE

step1.para: If disassembled, install the thrust washer and sleeve in the spindle of greasable drive flange models. If a non-greasable drive flange model, install the felt seal, retainer, thrust washer and sleeve in the spindle ( Figure 34).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Installing Felt Seal, Retainer, Thrust Washer and Sleeve

para.emph: ASSEMBLY TIP: On larger model axles, spindle installation will be easier if you install two temporary pilot studs into the knuckle 180 degrees apart. Tighten the studs finger tight ( Figure 35).

step1.para: Install the spindle flange against the knuckle with the keyway slot of the wheel bearing adjusting nut toward the top.
For steps 3 and 4, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the type of brake being serviced.

Install the brake backing plate adapter, if used, the brake assembly and the oil deflector on to the spindle. Fasten all parts to the spindle with capscrews and washers. Tighten to correct torque. Refer to TORQUE CHART.
Connect all air lines to the brake.
